channel.title: A thought of mine
channel.description:
Well we all know here at moparisthebest.com know how annoying those damn noobs can be who post "HEW DO I DO TEH MOPARSCAPES HAX?" well what punishment do they get? usually lately ive seen nothing, their posts are locked and they are told to go to moparisthebest.com.
I was thinking perhaps we should have a proper punishment for this, such as a "stupid crown" which they have to wear for ages, like the "Warned" or "muted" signs people get.
I dont know... just a suggestion.. what else can we do to stop the noobs from posting? i've tryed being nice and i dont know how long i can keep it up, but yeah..... lol.

item.title: A thought of mine
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

[quote=“jme_009, post:20, topic:108934”]When I was a mod, I sometimes gave out warnings.

Usually only if I was stressed at the moment(I know, thats a poor reason), or they made multiple threads. But I gave it out because it is just pure ignorance to post moparscape questions here. The rules say no, the stickies say no, the questions section description says no. It couldn’t be anymore obvious that they are not supposed to post there. If they can’t respect our forum rules, why should we help them out.[/quote]
exactly…

[quote=“alex4ever, post:19, topic:108934”]i still think we should just let thw mods g mods and admins talk about it.
and figer out what they should do[/quote]
Well sure they can sort it out, but there isn’t a problem with us suggesting stuff.[quote=“1337h4x, post:16, topic:108934”]and make the “Click here if you are interested in RuneScape Private Servers” redirect to wowomg[/quote]
Best idea ever.

Read full topic

item.title: A thought of mine
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

When I was a mod, I sometimes gave out warnings.

Usually only if I was stressed at the moment(I know, thats a poor reason), or they made multiple threads. But I gave it out because it is just pure ignorance to post moparscape questions here. The rules say no, the stickies say no, the questions section description says no. It couldn’t be anymore obvious that they are not supposed to post there. If they can’t respect our forum rules, why should we help them out.

Read full topic

item.title: A thought of mine
item.dc:creator: @Tribal Tribal
item.description:
@Tribal wrote:

[quote=“Mod Taharok, post:15, topic:108934”][quote author=Tribal link=topic=155874.msg1468980#msg1468980 date=1181601087]
I suggest we make this the first time you enter the site MITB you won’t enter the site but you will get a choice , something like this :

If you are interested in Java programming…click here | If you are interested in Runescape pv-servers…click here
|

First option will redirect you to MITB and second option to Moparscape obviously.
This way i’m pretty sure less or no people will come on MITB and ask questions about Moparscape.
[/quote]

More like:

Click here if you are interested in RuneScape Cheating | Click here if you are interested in RuneScape Private Servers[/quote]
yea whatever its just the idea im talking about not about how its going to look like.
And by the way its better to cut away the “Runescape cheating” part cause this will atract noobs too.
anyway it’s not a bad idea is it?

Read full topic

item.title: A thought of mine
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Well can we have a sticky implemented saying to report the threads using the “report to moderator” button, because at the moment to many people post on the thread (in turn bumping it) and sometimes even flame wars occour. It would work alot smoother that way imo.

Read full topic

item.title: A thought of mine
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Not going to work. If anything, implementing this idea would make the staff look poor and would reflect badly on the forums. Who wants to join a community that attacks people for mistakes?

Read full topic

item.title: A thought of mine
item.dc:creator: @1337h4x 1337h4x
item.description:
@1337h4x wrote:

[quote=“billygotshot, post:8, topic:108934”]i think i was the only person who didnt post on this forum or have an account until i had moparscape client and had my own server and found out how to make npcs cmds and shops…[/quote]do you really think we care?

Read full topic

item.title: A thought of mine
item.dc:creator: @Brendan Brendan
item.description:
@Brendan wrote:

However bad MoparScape may be, I’ll always try to help people that need it. I’ll always try to make MoparScape a better place. However, I myself cannot do that. I’ve been trying my best to do that for 5 months, it hasn’t payed off. Eventually, it got really bad and the spam just kept mounting up. I think everyone’s just given up on it.

Anyway, on-topic, I agree with Bob. We shouldn’t be mean to people. Simply telling them to go to MoparScape is a better idea. Not branding them for a simple mistake.

Read full topic

item.title: A thought of mine
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Fair enough… but i really do think a warning should be given for any post like that, i mean i got warned for posting a silly picture (Sure i should have known better) but so should have the noob.

A warning… along with a PM explaing about it will be liften in 7 days, and the reason why, and the right site to go to (e.g. moparisthebest.com/smf)

I mean its better then just letting them get off scot free? And how in the world did they pass the test to get in here?

Read full topic

item.title: A thought of mine
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

I’ve only given moderations if people continue to ask on these forums once we have redirected them. Typically, the people who are asking are new members who can’t be bothered to read anything (unfortunately). But we even have to remind some of the better members of the rules…people turn out different, and I’m sure that although 90%+ of those members will simply leech and not contribute a thing, some will turn out to be fairly active and helpful members of the community.

Thus, I don’t really agree with that kind of degrading message…maybe we could start doing warnings (dunno yet though), but I don’t agree with a stupid crown.

Read full topic

item.title: A thought of mine
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

[quote=“1337h4x, post:2, topic:108934”]how do I make a moparscape server?

offtopic: stupid crown is a pretty nice idea tbh. But then again there just retarded and they can’t help it. Imagine if you were that stupid. lol nevermind that.[/quote]
yeah i know… and i know that a stupid crown probably wouldn’t actually do anything to them, but at least it would make me feel better [br][size=1]Posted on: June 10, 2007, 05:08:01 PM[/size][hr][quote=“Brendan, post:3, topic:108934”]You think the spamming is bad here? Go to the MoparScape forum and you shall realise that the spam here is nothing. Moderators aren’t even doing their job in that forum anymore.[/quote]
i can’t bare to actually venture over there… To be very perfectly honest i think ive only visited moparisthebest.com/smf once… and didnt even read any posts lol.

Read full topic
